intro: Geissorhiza obtusata, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces tall, branched stems. Geissorhiza obtusata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
